SEARCH
Package chessapi4j.functional

Class Position

java.lang.Object
chessapi4j.functional.Position
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Position extends Object implements Serializable
Instances of this class represents a chess position. This class is immutable so it is thread-safe and functional friendly.

An instance can be created in many ways:

  • using the Factory class
  • using the Generator class
  • using the public constructor Position(String)
  • using the children() method
  • using the move(Move) method
  • using the move(String) method
  • using the sanMove(String) method

Due to the immutable nature of this class and the consequent thread-safety behavior, the startpos can be reduced to a singleton instance. If you need the startpos you can just call Factory.startPos().

The state of the position such as the check, checkmate, stalemate, lack of material or fifty moves situations can be obtained using the corresponding methods.

Since:
1.2.9
Author:
lunalobos
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • bitboards

      public long[] bitboards()
      Returns the bitboards representing this position as an array of longs. The bitboards are ordered according to the Piece enum, excluding any entry for empty squares for obvious reasons.
      Returns:
      an array of longs representing the bitboards for this position

    • wm

      public long wm()
      Side to move rights. If white moves return 1L, if black moves return 0L.
      Returns:
      the side to move rights in long representation

    • whiteMove

      public boolean whiteMove()
      Side to move rights. If white moves return true, if black moves return false.
      Returns:
      the side to move rights in boolean representation

    • wk

      public long wk()
      Returns the white castle kingside right as a long, meaning 1 that white can castle kingside and 0 that white can not castle kingside.
      Returns:
      the white castle kingside right as a long

    • whiteCastleKingside

      public boolean whiteCastleKingside()
      Returns true if white can castle kingside, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      the white castle kingside right as boolean

    • bk

      Returns:

    • enPassantSquare

      public int enPassantSquare()
      En passant square. This is the square index of the pawn that can be capture using en passant rule. This is not the same square that is shown in fen representation.
      Returns:
      the en passant square

      Returns:
      the fen

    • getSquares

      public int[] getSquares()
      This method returns a 64 length array. It contains the piece value for each square according to Piece ordinal values.

      Each index represents a square, the value represents a piece

      ---------Board---------

      56 57 58 59 60 61 62 63

      48 49 50 51 52 53 54 55

      40 41 42 43 44 45 46 47

      32 33 34 35 36 37 38 39

      24 25 26 27 28 29 30 31

      16 17 18 19 20 21 22 23

      08 09 10 11 12 13 14 15

      00 01 02 03 04 05 06 07

      This method consumes computation, squares array is not cached.

      Returns:
      the squares array

    • zobristHash

      public long zobristHash()
      Zobrist hash. See Zobrist_Hashing
      Returns:
      the zobrist hash

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      For this class hashCode is identical to call zobristHash() and then apply the hash standard method to that value. 
      
 var position = ...
 var hash = ((Long)position.zobristHash()).hashCode();
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hashCode

      public List<Square> getSquares(Piece piece)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a List with all the squares where is a piece like the given as argument

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.

      The game is over if it is checkmate, stalemate, fifty moves, lack of material or repetitions.

      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • draw

      public boolean draw()
      Retrieves if the current position is a forced draw.

      A position is considered a draw if it results from stalemate, the fifty-move rule, insufficient material, or threefold repetition.

      Returns:
      true if the position is a draw, false otherwise

    • children

      public List<Tuple<Position,Move>> children()
      Retrieves the children of the current position in a List of Tuple<Position, Move> format.
      Returns:
      the children

    • isLegal

      public boolean isLegal(Move move)
      Checks if the given move is legal for the current position.
      Parameters:
      move - the move
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal false otherwise

    • move

      public Position move(Move move)
      Returns the position that results from the given move.

      The object returned is a new instance of this class.

      Parameters:
      move - the move
      Returns:
      the position that results from the given move

    • move

      public Position move(String move)
      Returns the position that results from the given move in Universal Chess Interface (UCI) format.
      Parameters:
      move - the move
      Returns:
      the position that results from the given move

    • sanMove

      public Position sanMove(String move)
      Returns the position that results from the given move in Standard Algebraic Notation (SAN) format.
      Parameters:
      move - the move
      Returns:
      the position that results from the given move

    • enPassant

      public Optional<Square> enPassant()
      Gets the en passant target square for the current position, if one is available.

      The en passant square is the *target* square a pawn lands on when performing an en passant capture (e.g., e3 or e6), not the pawn being captured.

      Returns:
      an Optional containing the en passant Square, or Optional.empty() if no en passant capture is possible.
      Since:
      1.2.11
